title: Bibliography
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section body" id="body">Art Institute of Chicago. The Lithographs of James McNeill Whistler. Vol. 1, A Catalogue Raisonné, Harriet K. Stratis and Martha Tedeschi, general editors, catalogue entries by Nesta Spink, Harriet K. Stratis, and Martha Tedeschi with the assistance of Britt Salvesen, and essays by Katharine Lochnan. Vol. 2, Correspondence and Technical Studies, Martha Tedeschi, general editor, Whistler-Way correspondence edited by Nicholas Smale, essays by Nicholas Smale, contributions by Kevin Sharp, and compilation of watermarks by Harriet K. Stratis. Art Institute of Chicago/Arie and Ida Crown Memorial/Hudson Hills, 1998.

Bendix, Deanna Marohn. Diabolical Designs: Paintings, Interiors, and Exhibitions of James McNeill Whistler. Smithsonian Institution Press, 1995.

Brewster, Walter Stanton. Exhibition of Whistleriana from the Collection of Walter S. Brewster. Exh. cat. R. R. Donnelley, 1917.

Brown, Roger. William Stott of Oldham (1857–1900): “A Comet rushing to the Sun.” Exh cat. P. Holberton/Gallery Oldham, 2003.

Christie’s, London. The New English Art Club Centenary Exhibition. Ext. cat. Christie’s, 1986.

Conlin, Jonathan. Tales of Two Cities: Paris, London and the Birth of the Modern City. Atlantic, 2013.

Cross, Tom. Artists and Bohemians: 100 Years with the Chelsea Arts Club. Quiller, 1992.

Dakers, Caroline. The Holland Park Circle: Artists and Victorian Society. Yale University Press, 1999.

Denker, Eric. Whistler and His Circle in Venice. Exh. cat. Merrell, 2003.

Denvir, Bernard. The Late Victorians: Art, Design, and Society, 1852­–1910. Longman, 1986.

Desmarais, Jane, Martin Postle, and William Vaughan. Model and Supermodel: The Artist’s Model in British Art and Culture. Manchester University Press/Palgrave, 2006.

Duchâtel, Édouard. Traité de lithographie artistique. [E. Duchâtel], [1893].

Gallatin, Albert Eugene. Portraits of Whistler: A Critical Study and an Iconography. John Lane, 1918.

Gilmour, Pat, ed. Lasting Impressions: Lithography as Art. Alexandria, 1988.

Glazer, Lee, and Linda Merrill, eds. Palaces of Art: Whistler and the Art Worlds of Aestheticism. Smithsonian Institution Scholarly Press, 2013.

Hausberg, Margaret Dunwoody. The Prints of Theodore Roussel: A Catalogue Raisonné. M. Hausberg, 1991.

Hopkinson, Martin, and Clare Tilbury. No Day without a Line: The History of the Royal Society of Painter-Printmakers, 1880–1999. Ashmolean Museum, 1999.

Jiminez, Jill Berk, and Joanna Banham, eds. Dictionary of Artists’ Models. Fitzroy Dearborn, 2001.

Laughton, Bruce. Philip Wilson Steer, 1860–1942. Oxford Studies in the History of Art and Architecture. Clarendon, 1971.

Lejeune, Anthony. The Gentlemen’s Clubs of London. Mayflower, 1979.

Maas, Jeremy. The Victorian Art World in Photographs. Barrie & Jenkins, 1984.

MacDonald, Margaret F. James McNeill Whistler: Drawings, Pastels, and Watercolours; A Catalogue Raisonné. Yale University Press, 1995.

MacDonald Margaret F., Susan Grace Galassi, and Aileen Ribeiro. Whistler, Women, and Fashion. With Patricia de Montfort. Frick Collection/Yale University Press, 2003.

MacDonald, Margaret F., and Patricia de Montfort. An American in London: Whistler and the Thames. Philip Wilson, 2013.

MacDonald, Margaret F., Patricia de Montfort, and Nigel Thorp, eds. The Correspondence of James McNeill Whistler, 1855–1903. Including The Correspondence of Anna McNeill Whistler, 1829–1880, ed. Georgia Toutziari. University of Glasgow, 2003–10. http://www.whistler.arts.gla.ac.uk/correspondence/.

MacDonald, Margaret F., Grischka Petri, Meg Hausberg, and Joanna Meacock. James McNeill Whistler: The Etchings; A Catalogue Raisonné. University of Glasgow, 2012. http://etchings.arts.gla.ac.uk.

University of Glasgow, History of Art and Humanities Advanced Technology and Information Institute. Mapping the Practice and Profession of Sculpture in Britain and Ireland, 1851–1951. Online database, University of Glasgow History of Art and HATII, 2011. http://sculpture.gla.ac.uk.

McConkey, Kenneth. British Impressionism. Abrams, 1989.

———. The New English: A History of the New English Art Club. Royal Academy of Arts, London, 2006.

Mendgen, Eva. In Perfect Harmony: Picture + Frame, 1850–1920. Waanders/Van Gogh Museum, 1995.

Menpes, Mortimer. Whistler As I Knew Him. Adam and Charles Black, 1904.

Parkerson, Sarah Lawrence. “Variations in Gold: The Stylistic Development of the Picture Frames Used by James McNeill Whistler.” Ph.D. diss., University of Glasgow, 2007.

Pennell, Elizabeth Robins, and Joseph Pennell. The Life of James McNeill Whistler. 6th ed. J. B. Lippincott/W. Heinemann, 1919.

Peppiatt, Michael, and Alice Bellony-Rewald. Imagination’s Chamber: Artists and Their Studios. New York Graphic Society, 1982.

Petri, Grischka. Arrangement in Business: The Art Markets and the Career of James McNeill Whistler. Georg Olms, 2011.

Postle, Martin, and William Vaughan. The Artist’s Model from Etty to Spencer. Exh. cat. Merrell Holberton/Rizzoli/St. Martin’s, 2011.

Robins, Anna Gruetzner. A Fragile Modernism: Whistler and His Impressionist Followers. Yale University Press, 2007.

Rutter, Frank. Theodore Roussel. Connoisseur, 1926.

Simon, Robin, ed. Public Artist Private Passions: The World of Edward Linley Sambourne. Exh. cat. British Art Journal/Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea Libraries and Arts Service, 2001.

Smith, Alison, ed. Exposed: The Victorian Nude. Tate Publishing, 2001.

———. The Victorian Nude: Sexuality, Morality, and Art. Manchester University Press, 1996.

Sutherland, Daniel E. Whistler: A Life for Art’s Sake. Yale University Press, 2014.

Swanson, Vern Grosvenor. John William Godward: The Eclipse of Classicism. Antique Collectors’ Club, 1997.

Tedeschi, Martha, and Britt Salvesen. “Songs on Stone: James McNeill Whistler and the Art of Lithography.” Special issue, Museum Studies 24, 1 (1998).

Tedeschi, Martha, and Nigel Thorp, eds. The Whistler Review: Studies on James McNeill Whistler and Nineteenth-Century Art. 2 vols. Centre for Whistler Studies, University of Glasgow, 1999–2003.

Waller, Susan S. Artists and Models in Paris, 1830–1870. Ashgate, 2006.

Way, Thomas Robert. Memories of James McNeill Whistler, the Artist. John Lane, 1912.

Worldsenders. “Lost Streets, Meek Street and the Proud City.” Worlds-Enders (blog), 2010. http://worlds-enders.blogspot.com/2010/02/lost-streets-meek-street-and-proud-city.html, accessed Oct. 16, 2013.

Young, Andrew McLaren, Margaret F. MacDonald, and Robin Spencer. The Paintings of James McNeill Whistler. With the assistance of Hamish Miles. 2 vols. Studies in British Art. Yale University Press, 1980.

</section>
